newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asia Fuel Oil- Firm on refinery shutdown news.
newsitem.headline: Asia Fuel Oil- Firm on refinery shutdown news.

text.p: The high sulphur fuel oil market was slightly firmer on Monday as news of some scheduled refinery maintenance turnarounds boost sentiment, traders said.
But they said the market is still long on the continued absence of Chinese playeras and ample supplies, traders said.
A major sold 20,000 tonnes of 180-cst grade at $98 per tonne for lifting March 26-30, traders said.
An independent was later heard bidding at $102 per tonne for March 22-26 lifting but could not find sellers.
"Some people are trying to push up prices," said one trader.
"There are still quite enough supplies, but we are entering the March turnaround season and the current big supply surplus should come down gradually," said one independent.
Two Singapore refineries -- Mobil and Singapore Refinery Co -- are scheduled to have maintenance turnarounds in March.
Another trader said China, which has covered its requirements for the fisrt half of March, appeared to start making some enquiries.
"They are not active, bidding at very low prices," the trader said.
Fuel oil swaps remained weak. March and April swaps were bid at $98 and $96.25 respectively, compared with Friday's $97.00/$98.00 and $96.00/$97.00.
The bunker market was quiet, with sellers speculating the cargo market might go up and unwilling to offer, traders said.
(Prices in dollars per tonne, unless stated)
MTH FOB SIN BUY/SELL PREV BUY/SELL
MAR FUEL OIL SWAPS 98.00/- - - 97.00/98.00
APR FUEL OIL SWAPS 96.25/- - - 96.00/97.00
*Dollars per barrel
--Singapore newsroom (+65-870 3571)
